section.title: Introduction
section.para: Using GAST, you can import and export metadata at will. It allows you to:

listitem.para: Create a backup of the entire metadata set. Each metadata has its own file, including maps and other data files. Once you have the backup, you can decide to import all or only some of them.

Move your metadata from one GeoNetwork catalogue to another. This can be done to mirror your metadata or to upgrade an old installation. In the last case, you export your metadata from your old installation and then re-import them into the new one.
Fill the system with test data. Using the ’skip UUID’ option, you can re-import the same metadata over and over again. This is useful, for example, if you want to perform stress tests.

section.para: Metadata are exported using the MEF format.

important.title: Ownership
important.para: Please, consider that the MEF format version 1.0 does not take into account user and group ownership. When exporting metadata, you loose this information. When importing metadata, the new owner becomes the user that is performing the import while the group ownership is set to null.

section.title: Import
section.para: This tool is located under Management tools on the left panel and allows you to import a set of metadata that have been previously exported using the export facility (see ). Selecting the Import tool opens the option panel on the right ().

formalpara.title: Input folder
formalpara.para:
the source folder in your system that GAST will scan to collect metadata to import. GAST will try to import all files with the MEF extension.
Sub-folders are not scanned.

formalpara.title: Browse button
formalpara.para: Navigate through your file system to choose an output location or enter it manually into the text field.

formalpara.title: Import
formalpara.para: This will start the process. A progress dialogue will be opened to show the import status.

section.title: Export
section.para: This tool is located under the Management tool on the left panel and allows you to export a set of metadata using the MEF format. Selecting the Export tool opens the option panel on the right ().

formalpara.title: Output folder
formalpara.para: The target folder in your file system where GAST will put the exported metadata. You can either select the Browse button to navigate through your file system to choose a better location or enter it manually in the text field.

formalpara.title: Format
formalpara.para: Here you can specify the metadata’s output format. See the MEF specification for more information.

formalpara.title: Skip UUID
formalpara.para: Normally this option is not required (see ). If you select it, you will loose the metadata’s unique identifier (UUID) but you will be able to re-import that metadata over and over again. This is useful to fill the system with test data.

formalpara.title: Search
formalpara.para:
Allows to specify free text search criteria to limit the set of exported records.
the export result will depend on the metadata visible to the searching user. If you do not authenticate, you will get only public metadata.

formalpara.title: Export
formalpara.para: This will start the export process. A progress dialogue will be opened to show the export status.

warning.para: Skipping the UUID on import or export can cause metadata to be duplicated. This should normally always be avoided
